Package com.hiddenswitch.spellsource

Interface Connection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    io.vertx.core.Closeable, io.vertx.core.streams.ReadStream<com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Envelope>, io.vertx.core.streams.StreamBase, io.vertx.core.streams.WriteStream<com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Envelope>
    public interface Connection
extends io.vertx.core.streams.ReadStream<com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Envelope>, io.vertx.core.streams.WriteStream<com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.client.models.Envelope>, io.vertx.core.Closeable
    Manages the real time data connection users get when they connect to the Spellsource server.

    To set up a behaviour that uses the real time connect, use connected(SetupHandler), which passes you a new connection to a unique user. For example, this code from the Presence package notifies users of their presence. 

       
     Connection.connected(Sync.suspendableHandler(connection -> {
 	  		final UserId key = new UserId(connection.userId());
 	  		connection.endHandler(Sync.suspendableHandler(ignored -> {
 	  			setPresence(key, PresenceEnum.OFFLINE);
 	  		}));

 	  		// Once the user is connected, set their status to online
 	  		setPresence(key, PresenceEnum.ONLINE);
 	   }));
 	   ...
 	   static void setPresence(String userId) {
 	   	final UserId key = new UserId(userId);
 	   	Connection.writeStream(userId, res -> {
 	   		if (res.failed() || res.result() == null) {
 	   			setPresence(key, PresenceEnum.OFFLINE);
 	   		} else {
 	   			setPresence(key, PresenceEnum.ONLINE);
 	   		}
 	   	});
 	   }
    Observe the use of the writeStream(String)}, which allows any code anywhere to send a message to a connected client. The write(Envelope) method can also be used in the connected handler.
